alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dauphin; Lebanon; Northumberland; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SCHUYLKILL...SOUTHEASTERN NORTHUMBERLAND...SOUTHEASTERN DAUPHIN...SOUTH CENTRAL COLUMBIA AND LEBANON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shamokin to 10 miles north of Annville to Hershey. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Pottsville, Hershey, Shamokin, Palmyra, Tamaqua, Mount Carmel, Schuylkill Haven, Shenandoah, Annville, Minersville, Mahanoy City, Cornwall, Frackville, Myerstown, St. Clair, Kulpmont, Ashland, Campbelltown and Orwigsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and south central Pennsylvania.
